summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to an employee being interviewed voluntarily as part of an investigation. The specific subject of the investigation is redacted. The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, acknowledging the voluntary nature of the interview.
keyFacts: The document is a Department of Justice OIG form (OIG Form 01-226/2) for voluntary employee interviews.
The form provides legal warnings that the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and statements may be used in future proceedings.
The specific subject of the OIG investigation is fully redacted in the text provided.
The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, indicating understanding and willingness to participate.
The document is part of the Epstein case files but contains no substantive information about persons, events, or the investigation's subject matter.
